Administrator.definition: a person appointed by a probate court to manage the distribution of the assets in the estate of a person who has died without leaving a valid will or leaving a will that does not name an executor able or willing to perform see also administratrix letters of administration at letter compare executor

1.definition: an administrator appointed to administer only a designated part of the deceased person's estate

administrator ad litem.definition: an administrator appointed to represent an estate that is a necessary party to a lawsuit

administrator de bo·nis non.definition: [-dē-bō-nis-nÄ n, -dā-bō-nis-nōn]an administrator appointed to administer the remaining assets in the estate when the preceding administrator or executor can or will no longer perform

administrator with the will annexed.definition: an administrator appointed to administer an estate where the will names no executor or where the named executor is incapable of performing or unwilling to perform called also

ancillary administrator.definition: a subordinate administrator appointed to administer the assets of an estate that are located in a different jurisdiction from the one where the deceased was domiciled and where the primary administration of the estate is taking place

foreign administrator.definition: an administrator appointed in another state

general administrator.definition: an administrator appointed to administer the entire estate of a deceased person in accordance with the laws of intestacy or in accordance with the will if there is one comparein this entry

independent administrator.definition: an administrator whose administration of the estate is entirely or mostly unsupervised by the probate court

2.definition: a person that administersthe head of a government agency
